poem:
### On the Edge of Ceasefire

In the land where olive trees  
whisper secrets to the wind,  
bullets claim the dawn—  
names fading into numbers,  
the barren earth  
thirsts for a truce.  
Negotiations are shadows  
on a sunlit wall,  
while ghosts of the fallen  
walk silent, unseen,  
through promises  
half-spoken, half-believed.
